title: All rounder
content: Reviewing after 5 days. Design feels solid as front and back both protected by gorilla glass 6. Easy to hold. Not bulky. Weight around 185 grams. Which is well distributed. Piano black color is descent. Comes with Android 10. Display is amoled. Shifted from ips display. Finding amoled display much better. Display size is 6.44 inches. So phone is not too big. Touch response is smooth. No lags or hanging. Works very smooth Haven't played games yet Charges fast. Gets slightly warm while charging as it 33 watts fast charging but does not heat or overheat Earphones are gud. Although design feels like copied from Samsung s20 ultra. Speakers are loud amd clear. No network issue till now. Earpiece quality is gud and mic also receive the audio properly. There is call recording option and native video calling Option. Triple card slot. Much required. 6 cameras- 4 in the back and 2 in the front. Cameras are gud. Sometimes there are issues in exposure while capturing through front camera. Background is blown out. But it can be adjusted before or after clicking the image. After adjusting exposure,pics comes quite natural and detailed. Rear Camera has pro mode. Images from back camera are really gud, natural, detailed, sharp. Video recording upto 4k 30 fps. 1080p 60 fps also available. Lots of customization features. Coming to price. Too much. Considering the fact it is offline centric. 22k should have been the price with some additional offers. Back cover provided is really gud. Fits tightly.
variant: Colour: Piano Black Size name: 128 GB Style name: with No Cost EMI/Additional Exchange Offers
author: Milan jeswani
product: Vivo V19 (Piano Black, 8GB RAM, 128GB Storage) with No Cost EMI/Additional Exchange Offers

title: not worth for money
content: This phone is not worth for 28k, performance is very bad. After using it for 7 day's I'm writing this review. 1. I am not a gamer or don't run any app to consume high performance. I have the regular banking and social apps and default phone apps. Internal memory not consumed more then 20gb. Still this phone takes time to load home page. This is really ridiculous. 2. Some modes in this phone are not working exactly upto the mark. A. Dark mode - it will not change to dark mode by the time I select, May change when phone wishes to do. Viseversa if i would like deselect dark mode. B. When loading - screen flickering occurs often in many common applications. GDrive, Gpay, whatsapp and opera browser. C. Receivers are not seeing my face in whatsapp app video call, in duo its working fine. Only in my call receivers facing this issue. Camera I did not test much, but I didn't see any issues. Clarity is good. Finget scan is not fast compare to competitor phones. My overall rating is 1 for 5 Complaint s registered with Amazon, Technician did not visit to inspect the phone. All the above complaints works randomly, I had screen recored and shots for proof to show.

title: Good design,sleek and value buy at this price
content: Last week I exchanged M01s for my existing M10. M01s screen is larger in size than M01 and very much resembles the M10. Camera quality is very good and so is battery power. Battery lasted me 1.25 days on moderate to heavy use. I take about2 hrs for mobile to charge. Memory of 3GB is good for videos, online calls without any lag. I am not a avid games user. Most amazing is the blue coloured. It has a metallic look and looks very nice. Iwasntsurewhen I ordered.

title: Nice Phone.
content: #Pros : 1.PlS TFT LCD panel which is better than IPS LCD 2.Dolby Atmos (In headsets only) 3. Nice UI(gets more better with update of android 10). 4. Battery backup: ‚Ä¢6-7hours(average use) ‚Ä¢4-5hours(heavily used) #Cons : 1.Micro USB(but it is not that bad.) 2.Only 7watt(5v~1.55A) charger in the box 3. Takes 3 hours to fully charge. 4. Old version of RAM (LPDDR 3) #Average: 1. Speakers 2. Buttons(Plastic buttons) 3. Processor (better than average,mediatek Helio P22) 4. ‚Ä¢Front camera is slightly less than average. ‚Ä¢Back camera is slightly more than average. #Verdict: Phone good and is for average person who want everything in his phone with a trusted brand.

title: Not up to the mark
content: Bought for my mother but callers repeatedly complained of choppy/unclear voice. I was certain that my handset has a defective microphone. Raised case with Amazon and they happily assisted with return and refund. 5 Stars to Amazon for support. But zero stars to Samsung. 2 days back I went to local market and again saw this device. Shopkeeper assured me of perfect functioning device but I did a test call and again caller complained of choppy audio. Prospective buyers please be aware of some potential issue with microphone clarity.

title: Black band and screen tint issue in july mfg unit, terrible one plus and amazon customer service.
content: Ordered one plus 8 Pro on 25th July, received on 30th July. Manufacturing was also July 20 so I was hoping this would be a flawless unit but nope. within 48 hours I saw hole-punch banding, screen tint as well. One plus customer care didn't connect me to any executive on call for over an hour, they even abruptly denied me any support through chat even after I qued for chat support from a laptop. I was on call for over an hour and qued for a chat via laptop for about 45 mins (photos attached, you can see the call wait time on the phone as well). Amazon has been messing with the replacement process as well, no help from amazon or one plus. It's been months of continuous issues and one plus still hasn't figured a way to solve this. Disappointed. I waited for one extra month to buy the phone so that the new units would be perfect. Amazon and one plus are partners in this fraud.

title: Good Purchase overall
content: This phone has its pros and cons. Pros are: 1. Super responsive device (no lags at all) 2. Typical impressive Oxygen Os (i can nitpick few things though) 3. Good all round camera(front one could have ben better) 4. Superb gaming experience, this device is a beast for gaming. 5. Has USB-PD support too, didn't know till I used a pd charger in this device. Cons: 1. Black crush issue is there when set to 120Hz refresh rate, maybe can get fixed through an OTA and its not a deal breaker for me 2. Horizontal black bar is present from front camera area when set to 120Hz, don't know if it can be fixed with an OTA update or not, again not a deal breaker for me 3. I miss the headphone jacküòÖ. Overall i am happy with my purchase. All I wanted a super fast and responsive device. I can ignore the display issues becz it appears in certain circumstances only, rest of the phone experience is amazing.

title: Stay away
content: This is for sure my last android phone. I have been a hardcore android user nd lover since samsung galaxy 2 days but now after using iphone xr for 4 months, I can't stick to android anymore. The smoothness,ui and apps compatibility provided by ios is unmatched even by this 120 hz monster by oneplus. Surely the screen quality is one thing,which iphones can't match with android but apart from that its worthless to spend so much on android. I am specifically giving one star to oneplus for its build quality. I dropped my phone from 6 inch height on a tile and the side frame literally chipped off from one edge. I would have tolerated a scatch or a dent but the metal piece just chipped off completely like a brittle substance. This can't be expected from a flagship.

title: Impressive so far! Apprehensive about display "issues"
content: After one day of use: Stellar camera, smooth UI, battery takes a beating with 120hz and Qhd+ turned on. But then again the charge out of the box gets you back up in no time. For reference, my previous phone was a Poco F1 and I use it for emails, social media, podcasts and viewing video content. I found the camera inadequate on the Poco F1 and boy this phone is certainly an upgrade in the photography department! My unit was manufactured in June. I do seem to have the "black crush" issue. I streamed a video on my poco and on this phone, clearly shadows are crushed, details are lost, there are gradient lines in the shadows unlike my Poco which looks cleaner with more details in the shadows. I don't know if you think of this as a deal breaker. Maybe it is (esp if it's a hardware issue). I'm going to stick with the phone as I don't think of it as a major problem. And yes, I tried turning off 120hz and Qhd+ , I've compared at different levels of brightness and no real difference: shadows, darker regions look cleaner on the Poco's  IPS panel. OS Update did not help either. Again, not a big deal and you'll probably never be bothered by it. Don't particularly care for the curved screen beyond the "wow it's like a waterfall" feeling you get for the first 10 minutes. It is a big phone, not so much when using it but when you want to put in your pocket.

title: An overall view of the mobile
content: The OnePlus 8 Pro has a similar design as the OnePlus 8 but with some subtle changes. Its display is actually rounded on the sides, rather than just having curved glass like on the 8. As a result, the display offers a more immersive feel, but this also means your fingers are almost always touching some part the screen whenever you hold this phone. # Highlights 1) very good rear camera that clicks beautiful and excellent pictures. 2)Bright, fluid display 3)fast wireless charging 4) Nice built quality, splash resistance 5)Solid overall performance #Cons 1) Selfie camera could be better 2) Battery Life is not up to the mark 3) Price is a little bit high for this mobile 4) Excessive Rear camera Bulge 5) Finally, IT WAS MADE IN " CHINA "

title: Not exactly as per the hype
content: I've given 3 stars. So, let me explain why. Pros which warrant 5 stars: 1. The superfast charging, the screen quality, the smooth feel, the amazing speaker. I can add a few more. 2. Screen is particularly awesome with adaptive colour changes which is very soft on eyes. 3. Similarly speakers are really good and loud. Amazing. Cons that made it lose stars: 1. Battery: a phone with 120 hz and QHD+ display warrants a bigger battery. 4500 mah can never last a day. 2. I paid for 4 cameras, I got three. 3. It has Snapdragon 865, supposedly the fastest chip around. Yet my telegram and chrome have hanged multiple times by now (in barely one week of use). 4. I was using Redmi note 5 pro before. May be I shouldn't be comparing an in-screen fingerprint reader with a dedicated one at the back, but that was a way cheaper phone. The fingerprint reader on that worked really smooth. Here, well it works. Is it a great phone? Yes. Will I recommend buying it? Yes. But does it do justice to its reputation? No. Hence, the rating is the gap between expectation and reality.

title: Very good Basic phone from Nokia
content: If you are looking for Nokia brand and just feature phone and i would certainly recommend it. This basic phone will be very useful for people who wants to listen to songs and capture some images (of course it is just 0.3 MP camera). It comes from the brand Nokia which is reliable brand in basic category. Pros: Dual sim is plus point for many people who uses two SIM . Easy navigation for those who try to learn phone usage first time (Applicable to elders who are getting used to) Battery life is very long lasting as many Nokia phones. Sound is good -clear and audible. Loud speaker sound might not be enough , hold on that is decent though. Sturdy phone for long durability. Cons: Price factor is little high but that's okay for a phone to get it from Nokia. We got it for 2350 in Festive sale. Verdict: Recommended if you want only basic feature phone with MP3 player and camera. (Don't expect much from basic phone, because it is to simplify needs).

title: Fantastic mobile with front camera and front flash
content: After using a smartphone for a little too many days and being stuck in constant distractions, I've traded in my smartphone for this dumb phone, and I've been so happy with this decision. The OS is simple and lag free, basic functions like the camera and music player work as expected. The music player is a little too bare-bones for my liking but it's still passable at this price. Call quality is good, battery life is pretty good as well, and it recognises 4G sim cards albeit it doesn't really support 4G call quality or even the internet! Overall this phone is great for minimalists, the elderly, or really anyone looking for a digital detox.

title: Perfect phone
content: A neat, lightweight little phone with dual SIM and internet connection - although I won't use the latter. I bought it because for my grandmother and I wanted a phone with a camera.....but not a Smartphone.  1) First thing - it comes with a charging cable on the end of which is a 2-pin continental type plug. 2) It's fairly straightforward to set up which is just as well as the instruction sheet lacks any instructions in English! I have found the manual on the Nokia website, so that's okay. I have one or two quibbles with this phone not least of which is the main control button - that big(gish) square one in the middle.  By default the menu choice always seems to be on Messaging, and moving it, using said button, is, at times, tricky. Oh - and if you want to listen to music on this phone don't think you can use just any old headphones - nope, you need to get them from Nokia, which, personally, I think is outrageous and greedy. I'm quite happy with this phone, certainly the dual SIM wil l be useful when I go travelling again - saves having to change SIMs or buy a phone in a foreign country - that was another reason for buying this phone.

So I opted for this one. I installed 32GB card for extra storage & it is functioning well without any lagging. Sound quality is OK with earphones but it starts to crack when played in speaker mode. It has 2 VERY BASIC cameras (front & rear) with flash on both sides. I am happy with the product.

You will also not be able to consume 3G services on this phone. The body is plastic and this time Nokia has used cheap quality plastic as used by other manufacturers. The right shortcut button takes selfie and cannot be configured to do anything else which is a kind of stupid thing on a phone with very very poor camera. Overall, the purpose of using a feature phone with keypad is served but the price tag is very high and you pay it for Nokia brand. However the overall build quality is not what it used to be of Nokia phones. Same priced Samsung phones offers quite a lot features, better build quality and better OS.

title: Barely ok. Massive downgrades from older nokia phones
content: Been using this phone since 2016. Looks and feels like a old school nokia at first. But they have downgraded certain features which were very important to me. Firstly, java games like doom rpg which used to run fine in phones from 2006-7 are stuttering in this phone from 2016. They seemed to have skimped out on ram for some reason. Secondly, the music player in this one is the most stripped doen version in any phone it is a significant downgrade since the old nokia phones. It is such a massive disappointment that it is amazing. The music player has no equalizer the shuffle feature shuffles both on the next and previous buttons whereas older nokias would randomize on the next button and play the last song on the previous one. Lastly and the biggest problem is no search feature in the music player. Who ever designed this player needs to be fired seriously. It supports 32 gb memory cards but does not have a search feature on the music player.makes no sense. It is a pain to find anything in the player. What makes this even more nonsensical is the fact that nokia phones from a decade ago did all these things that i just described. If i knew about these problems which i described beforehand i would have never bought this. Other than these problems (huge in my opinion) the phone is fine.

title: Major Battery Issues/Starting Problem
content: Very poorly built flimsy phone. To begin with, I put my sim and battery and pushed the start button. It did not start. After trying to many hacks like tapping the phone, removing and putting the battery again etc. it finally switched on after 10 minutes. It switches off at its will. When a call ends, the phone too gets switched off. Doesn't switch on again unless you connect a charger. The charging patterns are horrible. It shows fully charged withing a minute of charging.  That's perhaps Nokia's definition of fast charging. Just that it switches off withing 5 mins again. Pathetic phone. Some sort of electronic junk. And since it is bought mostly for elders and new cell phone users, they struggle with its inconsistencies. Add to that pathetic service by Amazon for this product. Neither they are replacing product nor are they collecting return and refund money. They only keep updating erroneous/false order status. A strict No-Buy!
